[3] Here, we noticed that Phe432 in the compound 1 cocrystal structure adopts the same conformation as in the apo form. [4] When compared with the reported structures of arachidonyl inhibitor MAFP in rat FAAH (PDB code: 1MT5) and piperidine-urea compound PF-750 in a humanized rat FAAH chimera (PDB code: 2VYA) (â€“), compound 1 shows the same covalent mode of inactivation, in which the urea carbonyl is attacked by Ser241, despite the evident difference in the chemical structures of these covalent adducts. [5] Furthermore, the adducts from these ligands, attached to the catalytic Ser241, follow a similar path toward the united portion of the MAC and ABP and make extensive van der Waals contacts with numerous hydrophobic residues in this proximal portion of the active site. [1] In summary, the structural data revealed that compound 1 inhibits FAAH through urea carbonyl acylation of the catalytic nucleophile Ser241 with the 2-fluoroaniline moiety as the leaving group (Fig.Â 3C). [2] Compound 1 behaves as a suicide substrate inhibitor.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, urea is involved as a key component in the mechanism of action of compound 1, which acts as a suicide substrate inhibitor of fatty acid amide hydrolase (FAAH). The urea carbonyl is specifically targeted and acylated by the catalytic nucleophile Ser241, indicating a direct relationship between urea and the inhibitory action of the compound. This highlights the role of urea in the design of inhibitors that interact with the enzyme's active site, showcasing its significance in the context of enzyme inhibition.
